overview: From 2025-12-17 to 2025-12-18, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 14 new PRs (5 merged), 3 new issues, and 34 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Document cannonKonaPrestate requirement for upgrades
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body:
While `opcm.upgrade` does not enforce that the cannon-kona prestate is empty, standard chains should always set the cannon-kona prestate. 
Let's find a suitable location to document this requirement for standard chains. Perhaps it could be defined in https://specs.optimism.io/protocol/configurability.html.

topIssues.title: write a p/ps for our release process
topIssues.author: nonsense

topIssues.title: Set default respected game type to CANNON_KONA
topIssues.author: pauldowman
topIssues.body:
With Upgrade 18 the CANNON_KONA game type will become available but is intended to be a fallback only, in the case of a problem with op-program. 

This issue is to change the default so that CANNON_KONA is the primary game type.

topIssues.title: Add Resource Locator for v7_0_0 artifacts
topIssues.author: 0xiamflux
topIssues.body: `op-deployer/pkg/deployer/upgrade/v7_0_0/upgrade.go` needs to be updated to include an artifacts URL once they have been stored in remote storage.

topIssues.title: op-node: check for zero elasticity multiplier in eip1559 params
topIssues.author: joshklop
topIssues.body:
The elasticity multiplier is already guaranteed to be greater than zero:

https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/5401e3a46d4e193bbe5400b9c3948d8098c8692d/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L1/SystemConfig.sol#L449

but we can add that check to the derivation pipeline for redundancy in case we accidentally remove it from the contract. cc @mds1

topPRs.title: feat: have upgrade test blocks update every week
topPRs.author: smartcontracts
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**
This PR updates CI so that the fork block numbers used in the contract tests are updated weekly every sunday at approximately midnight. Additionally runs a CI job shortly after the update time that warms the CI cache for upgrade tests so that this change is transparent to developers.

topPRs.title: verify opcm v2
topPRs.author: AmadiMichael
topPRs.body: This adds support for OPCM V2 to VerifyOPCM while still maintaining support for OPCM V1

topPRs.title: op-chain-ops: Add command to calculate an output root from an EL endpoint
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

Add a op-chain-ops command to generate an output root using just an execution client endpoint. Useful for checking validity of output roots against RPC provider services which don't expose the op-node `optimism_outputRootAtBlock` endpoint.

topPRs.title: fix: Apply deployment overrides when checking custom intent
topPRs.author: janjakubnanista
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Currently, we rely on deployment overrides when running `op-deployer` v5 in netchef, specifically to set the `operatorFeeVaultRecipient`. However, the merging of the global overrides is only being done in specific points in the codebase and was not being applied to the `Apply` action.

topPRs.title: op-node: validate EIP-1559 params in derivation pipeline
topPRs.author: copilot-swe-agent
topPRs.body:
Adds redundant validation for zero elasticity multiplier in EIP-1559 parameters during derivation, providing defense-in-depth against contract-level checks being accidentally removed.

## Changes

- **Validation in `ProcessSystemConfigUpdateLogEvent`**: When processing `SystemConfigUpdateEIP1559Params` events, decode and validate that denominator and elasticity satisfy: both â‰¥ 1, or both = 0 (the latter being a special case translated to protocol constants downstream).

- **Test coverage**: Added test cases for invalid combinations (zero elasticity with non-zero denominator, and vice versa) plus the valid (0,0) case.

## Rationale

The SystemConfig contract already enforces `denominator >= 1 && elasticity >= 1` at L449. This adds the same check in the derivation pipeline, ensuring invalid params are rejected even if the contract check is removed.

```go
case SystemConfigUpdateEIP1559Params:
    // ... parse params ...
    denominator, elasticity := eip1559.DecodeHolocene1559Params(paramsBytes)
    if denominator == 0 && elasticity != 0 {
        return fmt.Errorf("invalid EIP1559 params: denominator is 0 but elasticity is %d", elasticity)
    }
    if elasticity == 0 && denominator != 0 {
        return fmt.Errorf("invalid EIP1559 params: elasticity is 0 but denominator is %d", denominator)
    }
```

completedItems.title: ci: Fix contracts test-upgrade test junit output
completedItems.body:

1. The CCI config redirected all output to the XML file
2. The test-upgrade target calls `prepare-upg
